wrangler 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Calculate summary statistic for numerical variables

    stat_calc.Rd

    Calculate summary statistic for numerical variables

    stat_calc(data, decimal = NULL)

    Arguments

    data

    specify a dataframe

    decimal

    round the values to a number of decimal

    Examples

    stat_calc(iris[, 1:4])
#>           Sepal.Length  Sepal.Width  Petal.Length   Petal.Width
#> n         1.500000e+02 1.500000e+02  1.500000e+02  1.500000e+02
#> min       4.300000e+00 2.000000e+00  1.000000e+00  1.000000e-01
#> max       7.900000e+00 4.400000e+00  6.900000e+00  2.500000e+00
#> mean      5.843333e+00 3.057333e+00  3.758000e+00  1.199333e+00
#> median    5.800000e+00 3.000000e+00  4.350000e+00  1.300000e+00
#> stdp      6.738557e-02 3.546951e-02  1.436547e-01  6.202864e-02
#> stds      8.280661e-01 4.358663e-01  1.765298e+00  7.622377e-01
#> skew      5.785284e+02 5.859773e+02 -5.049945e+02 -1.891620e+02
#> kurtosis -1.192901e+04 4.932011e+03 -3.029669e+04 -2.896781e+04
stat_calc(iris[, 1:4], 3)
#>          Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width
#> n             150.000     150.000      150.000     150.000
#> min             4.300       2.000        1.000       0.100
#> max             7.900       4.400        6.900       2.500
#> mean            5.843       3.057        3.758       1.199
#> median          5.800       3.000        4.350       1.300
#> stdp            0.067       0.035        0.144       0.062
#> stds            0.828       0.436        1.765       0.762
#> skew          578.528     585.977     -504.994    -189.162
#> kurtosis   -11929.015    4932.011   -30296.688  -28967.807
